body_html:
I'm having the same issues on Ubuntu 16.04.2LTS on a dell xps15 9560 with gtx 1050 4gb. I have the same paths set up as @StefanoD , nvidia-375.51 installed, CUDA-8.0 installed + CUDANN.

Instead I'm running into ImportError: libnvidia-fatbinaryloader.so.381.09: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory. Why does it ask for 381 and not 375?

LATER EDIT: Symbolic linking fatbinaryloader.so.375.51 to fatbinaryloader.so.381.09 did the trick for me.

body:
I'm having the same issues on Ubuntu 16.04.2LTS on a dell xps15 9560 with gtx 1050 4gb. I have the same paths set up as @StefanoD , nvidia-375.51 installed, CUDA-8.0 installed + CUDANN. 

Instead I'm running into ```ImportError: libnvidia-fatbinaryloader.so.381.09: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory```. Why does it ask for 381 and not 375?

LATER EDIT: Symbolic linking fatbinaryloader.so.375.51 to fatbinaryloader.so.381.09 did the trick for me.
